radiographic_examinations.findings: Thickening of the wall of the cecum and appendix, multiple small nodules in the greater omentum.
A large, lobular mass near the ileocecal valve, extending into the cecum, and an extrinsic mass surrounding the terminal ileum.

Focus of intense tracer uptake in the cecal region, multiple small omental soft-tissue nodules without 18F-FDG avidity, small volume of ascites in the pelvis, and several small pulmonary nodules (â‰¤9 mm) with low-level tracer uptake.
Suspicious masslike thickening in the cecum with intense 18F-FDG uptake, numerous soft-tissue nodules scattered throughout the abdomen and pelvis, and lung nodules with low-level 18F-FDG uptake.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Findings compatible with metastatic disease in the lung, suggestive of peritoneal carcinomatosis.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No obvious evidence of metastatic disease.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Approximately 6 months later, the level of carcinoembryonic antigen began to rise, and lung nodules enlarged.
Progression of bone lesions and development of pain.
